intro: Megalastrum angustum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved megalastrum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
